alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD AND CENTRAL LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Reynoldsburg, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Pickerington, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Canal Winchester, Johnstown, Hebron, Utica, Granville South, Beechwood Trails, Summit Station, Whitehall, Etna, New Albany, Jersey and Kirkersville. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 106 and 125. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
